thread.title: Which universities have places in Clearing 2015?
thread.title_full: Which universities have places in Clearing 2015? - Telegraph

author: Jack Kempster, Mark Oliver , Josie Gurney Read
title: Which universities have places in Clearing 2015?
text: Some features in the desktop version are not present in the mobile version. Check the desktop page for the full experience. A-level Results Day has finally arrived. For those of you who are in Clearing this year, we've produced this interactive graphic to give you an overview of which universities have places, the types of institutions that have places, and how many courses are on offer. • Download the Telegraph's Clearing app for iPhone and Android • Use our live Clearing vacancy search for up-to-date listings Each bubble represents a higher education institution in the United Kingdon – hover over (or click if using a tablet) to find out which university or college each bubble represents. Turquoise bubbles are those with Clearing places, while red bubbles indicate universities which are not in Clearing this year. The size of the bubble shows how many courses each institution has available in Clearing. The bubbles can be sorted in the following ways: • selecting 'Russell Group' separates those universities which are members of the elite 24-member group of research-intensive institutions from those which are not • by the male:female ratio of undergraduates • by the student:staff ratio of the university as a whole • by the percentage of students who are in employment or further study within six months of graduation • by the average Ucas points score of students at that institution Data is correct as of 6pm on August 12. To search for up-to-date vacancies, and find out which specific courses are available – as well as contact details for their admissions offices - check out our Clearing search tool . available online and via our iPhone and Android apps Please note colleges which do not have university status are excluded from some functions of this graphic due to a lack of data. This graphic may work slowly on older browsers. (Data provided by Ucas and the Higher Education Statistics Agency - Employment data has been taken from 2012/13) • Missed your offers and need to go through Clearing? Read our guide to make sure you're up to speed . • Done better than expected and want to explore your options? Check out our guide to Adjustment and 'trading up' . • Think you'd like to defer your place? Have a read about potential gap year options in the UK. • Download the Telegraph's Clearing app for iPhone and Android @telegraph
